subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
An unorthodox variant {{Han simp|熅|f=𥁕|t=昷|nocap=y}} which can be found in various historical dictionaries. <!-- Refer http://dict.variants.moe.edu.tw/variants/rbt/word_attribute.rbt?quote_code=QjAyNDIwLTAwMw#26 -->

Eventually adopted as an official form by the People's Republic of China in 1965 based on the {{w|Xin Zixing}} ({{w2|zh|新字形}}) standardized form of characters.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This character is also the preferred form used in modern Hong Kong, where traditional Chinese is used. <!-- Refer HKSCS 2016 (Table 2) and http://input.foruto.com/ccc/gongbiu/dzijingbiu/ -->
